subject: Sales
title: David Ogilvy: Sell or Be Damned
description: One-minute skill: David Ogilvy: Sell or Be Damned.

hook.text: Ogilvy was a chef, a spy, and a farmer before writing his first ad. He started at 38.

buildup.text: He believed ads existed to sell, not entertain. Every word had to earn its place on the page.

discovery.text: His Rolls-Royce headline and long-copy ad doubled sales overnight. Research beat guesswork.

twist.text: He hated clever ads that won awards but moved nothing. Creativity without results was vanity.

climax.text: He built the agency bearing his name into a global giant by insisting results beat artistry.

punchline.text: The greatest ad man just wanted to sell things.

quiz.question: What was Ogilvy's philosophy on advertising?
options: Ads must sell, not just entertain
